title: ‘We created more corners!’ Unai Emery defends Arsenal performance vs Sheffield United
text:
To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser that supports HTML5 video

Unai Emery attempted to defend Arsenal’s performance during their 1-0 defeat against Sheffield United by pointing out that his side ‘created more corners’.

Arsenal squandered the opportunity to move back into third place with a lifeless display at Bramall Lane which was settled by Lys Mousset’s 30th minute goal.

Emery again left Mesut Ozil out of his matchday squad and his side created virtually nothing against the newly promoted side, registering just three shots on target.

Advertisement

Advertisement

Afterwards, Emery, who has presided over a run of form which has seen his team take just 11 points from the last 30 available away from home, insisted Arsenal deserved more from the game and used the corner count as evidence.

‘Yes, we’re very disappointed with that result,’ admitted the Arsenal head coach in his post match press conference.

Lys Mousset’s goal condemned Arsenal to their second defeat of the season (Picture: Getty)

‘There is the result, and secondly is how we managed the 90 minutes in the match. Really I think we created more chances than them, the better chances, but tonight we didn’t achieve the efficiency to win that match.

‘We conceded more corners to them than we wanted, and from one they scored. Also, when they are pushing and they are taking a lot of corners, they can do that.

‘We created more corners, 12 [compared to] seven or eight for them, and also we had the chances and had a very clear penalty to Sokratis.

‘In the second half it was not easy to get chances, I think we controlled the ball more with possession because they conceded metres on the pitch and we had chances to score, but we didn’t achieve that goal to draw and the try to win.

Advertisement

Advertisement

‘I think we deserved more, I don’t think we deserved to lose that match but also I appreciate their work and they are here with their supporters and with that result, they felt strong to achieve that result. But we worked, but I can say for our players their attitude was good, they tried and I think we deserved more.’
